comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Evalyn Walsh McLean (1886-1947), wife of Edward Beale McLean, publisher of the Washington Post (1916-1933). Her wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evalyn_Walsh_McLean She was the last private owner of the Hope Diamond, among other highlights of her biography; she's also the "Mrs. Ned McLean" mentioned in the lyrics of Cole Porter's "Anything Goes."

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content:
wow..
"When Missus Ned McLean (God bless her)
Can get Russian reds to "yes" her,
Then I suppose
Anything goes."

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: She looks the part of a Cole Porter lyric, though, doesn't she?
